intro: Diplotaxis delagei, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other well-known mustard family plants. The plant is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure with hairy stems and bright yellow flowers. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately lobed, and often covered in fine hairs to reduce water loss. Diplotaxis delagei is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
